body.p:
Madisonville Ky 28th February 1865
His Exelency Thomas E. Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Madisonville Hopkins County Ky and vicinity would respectfully represent to your Excellency that a number of our Vetran Soldier boys from the Old 17th and other regiments have recently returned home and they feel that it is a great hardship after having faithfully served there country for nearly four years to be hunted harrassed and murdered by Guerilla Scoundrels Wherefore we these friends and neighbours Join with them in urgently soliciting your Excellency to grant to capt John H. Frost a returned Vetran Capt of ^the^ old 17 Ky Volunteers a commission to rais a company of state guards Capt Frost will rais his company mainly in this county and it will consist mainly of returned vetrans they deem this the best course for there safety and ^to^ rid the country of guerillas they would make but one condition that is that they be permited to ^make^ Madisonville Ky there Head Quarters when not on active duty we hope our request will be approved by you and a commission Sent to Capt Frost to rais a company of Mounted Infantry to be attached to any Regiment you may designate the company raised in this
county to have the privilege of making this place there headwuarters we are Dear Sir yours truly

James W. Wilkins
O. Waddell
J Frost
W M Brownine
Abel Newbrough
J B Earle
S. Rout
Dick Littlepage
J D Browning
F. M. Nisbet
C. A. Bowrland

Madisonville Ky
Feby. 28" 1865
Wilkins James W. And others.
T The Gov.

Ask that authority be given John H. Frost late capt. 17" Ky Vols, to raise a Co. of veterans for state service, headquarters to be at Madisonville Ky.
